titleStmt.title: The faithful inflamed lover: or, The true admirer of beauty Being an account of a worthy squire that married a farmers daughter. This beauteous maid his heart betray'd, he lov'd her not for store; he fought not one for wealth alone, he had enough before. To the tune of, Over hills and high mountains.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J[onah]. Deacon, at the Angel in Guilt-spur-street, without Newgate,

notesStmt.note: Wing CD-ROM, 1996 gives range of dates: 1685-1688; place of publication and publisher's name from Wing CD-ROM, 1996.
Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library, Oxford, England.
